I remember those days :D I wanted a conky on my desktop so bad LOL http://netdragon.sourceforge.net/ssuperkaramba.html
SuperKaramba is MUCH easier to use than conky, you just add little applets in and stuff
You had sensors on your desktop without installing extra software?
after installing and configuring lm-sensors, right click your gnome-panel click add to panel
there should be a sensors thing in the add to panel menu
if cleaning out your heatsinks doesnt help, your thermal compound has probably evaporated, pick up some Artic Silver 5 and replace it :D
gnome-panel is the control bar with the menus
oh, I thought the gnome-panel applet came installed my bad ><
what app?

right-click on your gnome panel (thats the grey bar at the top) and click add to panel, scroll through there and there should be one that says sensors-applet, also make sure you run sudo sensors-detect in a terminal to configure lmsensors
i reccomend that link
also, if you sudo killall gnome-panel in a terminal it will restart the gnome-panel, click add to panel again it should be called Hardware Sensors Monitor
=D glad to hear you got it :D
make a good backup of your system when you get it where you want it, then you can feel free to explore linux as much as you want :D
